meanings.definition: Severe or bare in appearance or outline.
meanings.sent1: The desert landscape was the starkest I had ever seen, with no trees or plants in sight.
meanings.sent2: The room was painted in the starkest white, making it feel cold and unwelcoming.
meanings.sent3: The stark white walls made the room look like a hospital, but without the nurses and doctors.
meanings.sent4: Her words were the starkest reminder of the harsh reality we were facing.
meanings.sent5: The contrast between the black night sky and the starkest moonlight was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: His dedication to his work was the starkest I had ever witnessed, never taking a break or resting.
meanings.sent2: The storm brought the starkest winds we had ever experienced, knocking down trees and power lines.
meanings.sent3: The chef's use of spices in the dish was the starkest surprise, making it either loved or hated by customers.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was the starkest contrast to the usual hustle and bustle of the city outside.
meanings.sent5: The starkest difference between the two candidates was their approach to solving problems, one being more radical than the other.
